items.title: On a day that 20 wickets fell, England's cowardly approach was an admission of defeat in Melbourne
items.description: Australia's batting order is unsettled, unbalanced and out of form, but it matters little as England throws in the towel and considers the challenge of a Boxing Day Ashes Test all too hard.

items.title: Mother and stepson drift 10 kilometres in Christmas paddleboard mishap
items.description: Police say two holidaymakers are lucky to be alive after being rescued from the cold waters of Port Phillip, south-west of Melbourne, on Christmas Day.

items.title: Police name person of interest in search for Hanukkah car arsonist
items.description: Officers in Melbourne's south continue to investigate an arson attack on a car with a Hanukkah decoration in the early hours of Christmas morning.

items.title: Master Lock Comanche takes Sydney to Hobart lead, with multiple retirements on day one
items.description: Master Lock Comanche takes over from LawConnect late on day one of the Sydney to Hobart, as tough conditions take their toll on the fleet, forcing a number of retirements. Look back at the action in our blog.

items.title: Boddington gold mine damaged in out-of-control bushfire
items.description: The bushfire remains uncontained and out of control, and has burnt through nearly 3,700 hectares.

items.title: Poland intercepts Russian plane, reports airspace breaches from Belarus
items.description: Poland has warned several incidents regarding airspace during the holiday season may signal a provocation.

items.title: At least 14 injured in a knife and chemical attack at factory in Japan
items.description: A man has been arrested after stabbing eight people at a factory in the Japanese city of Mishima.

items.title: Zelenskyy says he plans to meet with Trump on Sunday
items.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he is planning to meet with US President Donald Trump on Sunday to search for ways to end the war with Russia.

items.title: Christmas celebrations around the world in photos
items.description: From Bethlehem to Beijing, people around the world have been celebrating Christmas in their own traditional way.

items.title: Trump launches strikes against Islamic State militants in Nigeria
items.description: Donald Trump says he ordered a "powerful and deadly strike against ISIS terrorist scum" for targeting Christians at levels not seen for years.

items.title: US judge blocks deportation of anti-disinformation activist
items.description: A US judge temporarily blocks the Trump administration from detaining a British man over his work combating online hate and disinformation.

items.title: Teenager accused of Nazi salutes granted bail in ACT court
items.description: An 18-year-old Canberra man accused of performing Nazi salutes in public and spreading extremist propaganda has been released on strict bail conditions after spending Christmas Day in custody.

items.title: Police investigating Boxing Day stabbing death north of Alice Springs
items.description: Northern Territory police are investigating after a 35-year-old man was stabbed to death in a small town north-west of Alice Springs on Friday.

items.title: Were you paying attention to the news cycle this year?
items.description: The new year is fast approaching and it's naturally got ABC journalists reflecting on the year that's been. But how much of it do you remember?

items.title: Man charged with assaulting pregnant woman, shooting at police
items.description: A 39-year-old man has been remanded in custody after police allege he fired multiple shots at officers during a Christmas Eve incident in Canberra's north.

items.title: US Powerball lottery jackpot pays out $2.7 billion on Christmas Eve
items.description: The winning ticket was sold at a Murphy USA in Cabot, lottery officials in Arkansas said on Thursday, local time.

items.title: When bread mimics life: Japanese photographer uses evocative images to showcase Australian bakeries
items.description: Kazuaki Ono wanted to entice people from Japan to visit Australia by showing we have as much to offer with our food culture as we do with our iconic scenery.

items.title: Unaccompanied L-plater involved in pedestrian hit-and-run, police allege
items.description: A 23-year-old driver in a hit-and-run on Christmas Day following a roadside breath-test evasion in Tasmania's north west has been charged by police.

items.title: Iconic Top End national park under threat from near-invisible invader
items.description: Much-loved by locals and bringing in more than 250,000 visitors a year, Litchfield National Park has become one of the Northern Territory's star attractions. But it's under threat from a near-invisible invader.

items.title: Man killed by falling tree as three die in floods and mudslides in California
items.description: State authorities have declared a state of emergency in several counties, including Los Angeles.

items.title: Tim Wilson believes 'most' Liberal MPs would be untroubled by gay leader
items.description: In a broad ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, Liberal MP Tim Wilson speaks about what the Liberal Party should be fighting for and why he would one day like to be its leader.

items.title: Kamahl reflects on his life and career as he finishes likely final recording
items.description: At 91, Malaysian-born Australian entertainment legend Kamahl reflects on his life and career.

items.title: Putin critic and pro-war activist jailed by Russian court
items.description: Sergei Udaltsov, the leader of the Left Front movement that opposes President Vladimir Putin, was arrested last year.

items.title: King praises acts of 'spontaneous bravery' in Christmas message
items.description: King Charles III pays homage to those who confronted terror at the Bondi Beach massacre, acknowledging their "spontaneous acts of bravery" in his annual Christmas message.

items.title: Feeding the hungry in the car park of a suburban swimming pool
items.description: For almost six years, Aunty's Free Feeds has been serving home-cooked meals to anybody who needs them from a pop-up buffet in the car park of a swimming pool.
